page.title: 06Fakenham in the Past
page.content: Our grandparents remember that there used to be 2 railway stations in the town. There was a Thursday cattle market which sold cows and chickens. There were 2 schools (the Queen's Road School - now the Juniors - and a Methodist school), 4 harness makers' shops, 2 stone masons, 3 blacksmiths, 2 hotels and a horse drawn cab that met the trains and took the visitors to the hotels. There was a flour mill in Bridge Street. Most people were employed at the printing works or on the land. The Police Station used to be in Gladstone Road. The street lamps ran on gas. The Public Library used to be in a special building in the grounds of the Queen's Road school. The building was later used as a classroom and then knocked down. There was a big horse trough in the market square. There were 2 Picture Houses.
